[[Teresa Parker (Earth-616)|Teresa Parker]] | Origin = Club of assassins founded by [[Foreigner (Earth-616)|Foreigner]] | PlaceOfFormation = | PlaceOfDissolution = | Creators = Peter David; Dwayne Turner | First = Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man Vol 1 118 | First2 = (Mentioned){{sld|Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man Vol 1 123}}(First full appearance) | HistoryText = [[Foreigner (Earth-616)|Foreigner]] started a club of assassins called the 1400 Club. The CIA, FBI, and most government agencies throughout the world are not aware of the Foreigner's existence or that of his organization. In an attempt to impress the Foreigner and become a member of the organization, the assassin Sabretooth volunteered to kill the thief known as the Black Cat.{{r|Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man Vol 1 116}} The Foreigner hired [[Kirk Donaghue (Earth-616)|Blaze]] to fire-bomb the Black Cat's apartment.{{r|Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man Vol 1 123}} Foreigner's agents were responsible for the death of [[Edward Leeds (Earth-616)|Ned Leeds]].{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 1 289}} Foreigner worked alongside [[Felicia Hardy (Earth-616)|Black Cat]] in order to destroy Spider-Man, but it was later revealed he planned to recruit Spider-Man to the organization as a assassin.{{r|Peter Parker, The Spectacular Spider-Man Vol 1 129}} Foreigner hired [[Death Squad (Foreigner) (Earth-616)|Death Squad]] to kill Betty Brant Leeds, who was seeking to expose the Foreigner's role in her husband's death.{{r|Web of Spider-Man Vol 1 91|92}} [[Richard Fisk (Earth-616)|Blood Rose]] hired Foreigner's organization to bring down the remnants of the Kingpin's empire, who recruited [[Cyber-Hunters (Earth-616)|Cyber-Hunters]] and the [[New Enforcers (Earth-616)|New Enforcers]].{{r|Web of Spider-Man Vol 1 97|99}} [[Justin Hammer (Earth-616)|Justin Hammer]] turned the 1400 Club against him, and the organization was destroyed,{{r|Spectacular Spider-Man Vol 1 209|210}} but Foreigner reformed the organization.{{r|Captain America Vol 9 10}} | Notes = There may be a more secretive society within the 1400 Club called the 100 Club{{r|Marvel Comics Presents Vol 1 142}}, however this has never been expanded upon and may be a deception on the part of the Foreigner, or a misprint on the part of the writer/artists. | Trivia = | Links = }}
